intro: Reseda ellenbeckii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved reseda, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Reseda ellenbeckii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
